objective.para: Computers should invisibly handle uninteresting work so that we can work on interesting and difficult problems. I make sure that they are doing their job in a way that helps us do ours.

skillset.title: GUI Design
skillset.skill: Graphical Display of Quantitative Information training from Edward Tufte

description.para: VP of Client Facing Technology, driving technology innovation, client onboarding and satisfaction and representing clients in technology. Travelled to regional offices to visit clients to maintain relationships and drive sales. BNPP PB ranked #1 in total Global Custodian Prime Brokerage Survey 2012.

projects.project: Featured in COO Connect and Global Custodian in July 2012.

Primary technology representative during sales and onboarding for the group's most valuable clients. Designed, organized and implemented custom solutions to fit client needs for $1 billion+ hedge funds.

Business had poor viisibility into what was being rolled out when. Changed culture and process to serve both groups better. Planned and managed rollout of new PB Portal, Corporate Actions Portal, Wire Transfers, SMART Risk, Margin Reporting, International PB, and Securities Lending.

Designed and wrote guide to working with PB web services for clients, welcome packet, PB Technology Newsletter, marketing brochures, client updates, guide to reports, etc. Guided from conception through execution.

project.title: Managed Backend Transition for BOFA to BNPP sale

projects.project: During transition from BofA to BNPP, transitioned over a hundred backend reports.

description.para: Software developer for the BofA Securities Prime Brokerage, which has been consistently ranked #1 in technology among PB's in the Global Custodian Prime Brokerage Survey.

projects.project: Excel front end VSTO C# .Net system that provides real time profit and loss changes to hedge fund clients.
Client side Aspx pages that queried SQL Server and output to html, Excel, or pdf

project.title: Initiated, Created and Released Quick Trade Monitor

projects.project: Support tool for help desk to monitor EOD trade files using a Windows Forms GUI and web services.

project.title: Initiated, Created and Evangelized Support Queries Page

projects.project: Simple aspx page that reduced developer support time by 80%.
Used to build our staging, production and development environments from automatically built MSI files.
Built out support for Ezecastle, High Velocity Trading and other formats, built UAT environment, wrote client documentation package for this C# server that imported client trades to SQL Server.
Aspx page that used stored procedures to pull data into XML transform it to client's expectations using XSL.

achievements.achievement: Developed Real Time PNL 2 in 6 months with 75% resources. PNL2 supports 6000 simultaneous positions with real time pricing.

description.para: Software developer and trade support analyst for equities trading client connectivity team on the world's largest trading floor.

projects.project: IRC and PERL bot that monitored multiple databases for Program Trading desk.
PERL system to do deployments and intraday 1 second failovers for the A4 high velocity trading system.
From hardware to network to software to FIX messages. Responsible for client to market trade flow.

achievements.achievement: Won award: "Best Chatbot - UBS Global Equities" for interactive program trading flow monitor bot. Saved traders time and preserved client business, freed up 1 full support staff.

description.para: Software developer on the BRASS/UMA/U2 system, NASDAQ Market Maker software that processed up to 70% of the volume of the NASDAQ.
All development was done in C/C++, the frontend was MOTIF

projects.project: Allowed market makers to drip large orders out to the market in small timed chunks to avoid moving the market.
Led small team to perform code and core dump analysis. Simplified code, reduced instability and increased customer satisfaction.
Used Object Oriented Programming to simplify and centralize TIF code. Reduced related lines of code by 50%.
Wrote various bug fixes and customer requested enhancements.

achievements.achievement: Increased core stability of the system, hunting down the top instability issues.

employer.link: University of South Carolina Computer Services Department

description.para: SQL and GUI developer responsible for data integrity in transition of all alumni information from mainframe storage to relational databases.

projects.project: Wrote hundreds of sql data validation scripts to find unusual data for review and PowerBuilder frontends to display results to users.

achievements.achievement: Reduced mailing costs and increased data integrity.

award.title: NYC Music Hack Day: Best use of MusixMatch API
award.description: Proposed, organized and led Team Valentunes to create a site that finds songs to serenade your sweetheard, then calls them and plays them the playlist. Django based site and iPhone app completed in 24 hours from pitch to working demo. Won the MusixMatch best api use award: a trip to Italy.

award.title: WIRED: Best Short Story for "How to Safely Live on in a Science Fiction World"
award.description: Charles Yu and Wired held a contest to win the all-metal version of his debut novel. I won the contest with an auto-illustrating short story.

misc.para: This resume is composed in resume xml. One source file can be processed through various XSL transforms to produce many output formats.

note.para: In major with weighting for honors courses.
